properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 3 at 12:49PM EST until January 5 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Grand Rapids MI
properties.description:
...The flood warning continues for the following rivers in Southwest
Lower Michigan...

Grand River near Comstock Park affecting Kent County
Maple River at Maple Rapids affecting Clinton County
Grand River at Robinson Township affecting Ottawa County

.The crest on the Grand River is moving through the Grand Rapids area
today and will be down near Robinson Township Saturday morning. The
drop in water levels behind the crest will be very slow, and minor
flooding will continue through the weekend. Thankfully, no significant
rain or snow is expected over the next several days, which should
allow the rivers to continue falling through next week. The following
forecast is based on observed and forecast 48 hour precipitation.

The Flood Warning continues for
the Maple River at Maple Rapids.
* until Sunday evening.
* at 12:15 PM Friday the stage was 9.3 feet.
* Flood stage is 9.0 feet.
* Minor Flooding is occurring and Minor Flooding is forecast.
* Forecast, the river will continue to fall below flood stage by
Sunday morning.
* Impact, at 9.0 feet...Expect minor flooding of County Line Road and
a home along County Line Road.
* Flood history, this crest compares to a previous crest of 9.3 feet
on Nov 2 2019.
properties.instruction:
Safety message...Motorists should not attempt to drive around
barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.

Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local
radio... television... or NOAA Weather Radio station for further
information.

Additional weather and river information can be found on our homepage
at www.weather.gov/grr
